intro: Melandrium apetalum f. arcticum, commonly known as the Arctic sandwort, is a low-growing, perennial plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant thrives in cold, nutrient-poor environments, often found on rocky soils or gravelly ground. Its leaves are typically arranged in a rosette pattern, helping to conserve moisture in harsh conditions. The species is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient component of polar and mountain ecosystems.
